message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about energy and its consumption. Option (A) is correct because when a monkey has a puncture wound, its body needs to expend energy in order to heal and get better. Option (B) is incorrect because pencils laying flat on a desk do not require any energy expenditure. Option (C) is incorrect because paper fluttering around is not related to energy consumption. Option (D) is incorrect because a flower laying dormant does not require any energy expenditure.

This question requires basic knowledge about the concept of energy. Energy is required for processes such as healing and recovery, so a monkey with a puncture wound expends energy to get better. Option (B) is incorrect because pencils laying flat on a desk do not require energy expenditure. Option (C) is incorrect because paper fluttering around is usually caused by air currents, not energy expenditure. Option (D) is incorrect because a flower laying dormant does not require significant energy expenditure.

Option (B) is incorrect because pencils laying flat on a desk do not require any energy expenditure. Option (C) is a reference to air currents and not related to the expenditure of energy. Option (D) is incorrect because a flower in a dormant state does not require energy expenditure.

Option (D) is incorrect because a flower laying dormant means it is in a period of rest or inactivity, and does not require the expenditure of energy.
